content.description: Standing In The Eye follows the same natural line as Hurricane Without A Name but stand starts a little to the left on a jug pinch for both hands just wider than your shoulders. Move right and use all jugs and crack features to turn the roof. A ton of fun and more accessible than the two lower sit starts.
content.protection: 1-2 pads and spotter for the Topout fall line
content.location: (34.7377845, -98.6047589) Stand Start left of The Eye on two jug pinches.

content.description: Infinite Storm starts in the crack at the back of Hurricane roof. Start on hand jams in this crack and work up the vertical line and traverse the lip in a natural line following most of the jugs on the roof. Reach the second crack (right side) and orient for a committing topout sequence. +/- 15 moves on bomber rock and a natural obvious line.
content.location: (34.7377845, -98.6047589)Starts on jams in the crack against the back wall under Hurricane roof.

content.description: Hurricane Without A Name is an extremely high quality overhung jug haul that has crack tech interspersed under and over the roof. Half the jugs in the Wichita’s make up this most prominent direct line. Sit Start with a hand on the Incut Crimp to your left and the boxy jug to your high right. Pick feet and lift off into the natural Juggy line toward the crack feature and turn the roof for an exciting topout. Take a look at the fall lines and have a decent spotter. Although V4 is quite a strange compressed grade in the Wichita’s due to many factors, Hurricane Without A Name and others in the area and Paperboy Millionaire really make sense as indicative of the next step up from the best V3s in the refuge. Regardless of grade phenomena, the lines in the Hurricane Cave roof offer lots of potential for less obvious and higher grade climbs to be put up.
content.protection: 1-3 pads, fall from above the roof would be a wild ride

content.description: Hurricane Cave is just a few minutes west of Bad Beta Podcast Studios on the lower portion of the wall of climbs and features a tremendous sit start jug haul roof problem with crack features called Hurricane Without A Name, a stand start version called Standing In The Eye, and a hard and long natural line that runs through all the roof jugs and exits on the right side called Infinite Storm.A potential natural line exits the left side of the roof to a box jug that has not been worked yet - please work it and put it Up!There are likely less natural harder lines to connect under the roof.
